eventName: McDougall Cottage's Spring Fling Family Easter Celebration!
description: Join us for a weekend brimming with laughter, creativity, and the sweet delights of the season as we hop into Spring at McDougall Cottage's Spring Fling Family Easter Celebration!  All weekend long, we invite you and your clan to join us for an egg-citing time creating Sock Bunnies, beading Beautiful Butterflies, planting Posies and lots more! Challenge your family to a game of Carrot Toss, or Bunny Bowling and then search McDougall’s garden to receive a special Easter treat bag!   As an extra special treat, on Good Friday only, we’ll be offering free samples of freshly made Hot Cross Buns and sharing recipes, so you can try your hand at making this Easter goodie back home in your own “cottage”.  There’s something for everyone in your family to enjoy as we welcome the arrival of spring and celebrate the wonders of the season - our cozy historic Cottage on the banks of the Grand is the perfect backdrop for making memories and celebrating the spirit of new beginnings.Register for your preferred day and then drop in anytime between 11 a.m. and 3:30 p.m  Don’t miss out on this egg-cellent fun family day - reserve your spot soon!Advance tickets:  Children (age 3 years and up): $10 plus GST Accompanying Adults: $3 plus GST (Eventbrite fees apply)  Limited tickets are available for purchase at the door.  Door price:  Children (age 3 years and up) $15 (includes GST) Accompanying Adults: $6 (includes GST)

description: Everybunny is welcome this long weekend at Schneider Haus! We will be open Friday through Monday from 11 am until 4 pm.  *Friday only* - Stop by and taste test a traditional Easter treat fresh from our oven, Hot Cross Buns!   On Saturday, Sunday and Monday we will be hopping with awesome Spring crafts, like Easter egg bath bombs. Take part in our mini egg hunts and collect an Easter treat! Spot the golden egg during our scavenger hunt and enter in the chance to win a FREE membership to the Region of Waterloo Museums! Looking to take in some Springtime cuteness? Don’t forget to check in on our resident baby chicks chirping away! We are so egg-cited to see you this long weekend!

location.name: Old Post Office - Reading Room IdeaExchange

eventName: Conversations in Community Care: Women with ADHD
description:
Why are so many people are now being diagnosed with ADHD?Join Porchlight Counselling and Addiction Services for another event in our Conversation for Community Care series, this time on the experiences of late diagnosed ADHD women. In a world where the news is asking, "why are so many people are now being diagnosed with ADHD?", finding the right resources can be a challenge for late diagnosed ADHD women. The stigma they face is very real, and there is very little support in our public medical system.This panel will feature speakers from organizations who provide services and resources for later diagnosed ADHD individuals, as well as individuals who have the lived experience of learning that they have ADHD as an adult. Together, they will discuss what ADHD looks like into adulthood, what support is available in our community, and how to figure out your next steps if you aren't sure where to start. This event is free but attendees are encouraged to register in advance.COST: FreeAGE GROUP: |
Adults |EVENT TYPE: |
Lectures + Talks |TAGS: |
Mental Health |
Health |
Community |

eventName: *SOLD OUT* - A Special Gluten-Free Tea by the Grand at McDougall Cottage
description: Grab a friend, or two (or more) and join us for a gluten-free version of McDougall Cottage's ever-popular Teas by the Grand.  We’ll be serving up our classic Cottage tea, complete with cucumber and cream cheese tea sandwiches, smoked salmon cream cheese pinwheels, baked goodies and scones with preserves and whipped cream, but this time around, all are without gluten!**  You don't have to be gluten-free to enjoy this tea with all of its scrumptious treats – everyone will delight in this tasty event and what could be better than a chat and a nosh in a cozy 165 year old stone cottage?  **All of the baked goods for this special tea come from Gluten Free by Suzie's gluten-free certified bakery in Kitchener (https://glutenfreebysuzie.ca/ ). IMPORTANT: While this tea has exclusively gluten-free certified food, the kitchen at McDougall Cottage is not a gluten-free facility, therefore we cannot guarantee zero cross-contamination.  Please note If you have questions regarding dietary restrictions please contact us before purchase at mcdougall@regionofwaterloo.ca. Gluten-free options are only available at our specialty gluten-free teas. Check our website for upcoming dates or please email us. To assist staff with event set-up: If the members of your party are purchasing tickets individually, rather than under one reservation please email us in advance of the tea, so we can be sure to seat all the members of your party together mcdougall@regionofwaterloo.ca Children under the age of three do not require a ticket, however please let us know if they are attending so that we can account for that when planning our seating arrangements.

eventName: Schneider Haus April PD Day Camp
description: Join us at Schneider Haus for a day of engaging activities, with plenty of time outdoors, on April 10th! Programming provides a mix of free and structured play, allowing children to explore, create, build, dig, discover, and make new friends. Campers must bring a lunch and snacks. Food will not be provided. Please ensure your child is dressed for the unpredictable Spring weather!Age range: Children from 5 to 10 years old.Times: Drop off - 8:30 to 9:00 a.m. & Pick up – 4:00 to 4:30 p.m.Cost: $50 per day per child

Join us for an action-packed day at the Ken Seiling Waterloo Region Museum! Camp will be a mix of outdoor play, games, STEAM experiments, and crafts. Spend time exploring the museum, make friends, create memories, and have fun!Activities will take place indoors and outdoors, so please dress for the weather. Campers will need to bring their own lunch and two snacks.Age range: 5 to 10 years oldTimes: Drop-off is between 8:30 a.m. - 9:00 a.m. and pick-up is between 4:00 p.m. - 4:30 p.m.Cost: $50 per day per child (no HST, plus Eventbrite fees)Region of Waterloo Museums Member pricing: 10% off with code:No refunds, exchanges considered on a case-by-case basis.

Staff from John Howard Society's Cambridge Career Connections will be onsite to provide support and resources to job seekers.Drop in to meet with Employment Coordinators from Cambridge Career Connections to learn about FREE services to support job seekers in the Cambridge Community. eventName: Gardening Series: Pruning Trees and Shrubs
description: Learn the principles and methods of basic tree and shrub pruning in this hands-on workshop. Under the instruction of Bob Wildfong, our Heritage Gardener, you will prune young trees, shrubs and vines. Learn how to shape and train woody plants, repair damaged branches, revitalize thin growth, and stimulate foliage, flower and fruit development. $25 per person plus HST. Member’s discount applies. Capacity limited. Pre-registration required.Register here!  Information for Museum Members Region of Waterloo Museums Member pricing: 10% off with code Enter your 8-digit Member ID followed by "SEED" (i.e. 12345678SEED) into the discount field and select "Apply" to get member pricing. Please note that your membership must be valid upon booking and on the event date, or access may be denied.

eventName: Spring themed Lunch on the Woodstove
description: Cook with us in the historic Martin House in this hands on workshop. We’ll be using the wood fired cookstove to make a 1914 era spring meal to eat at the end of the session. The menu includes soup, quick bread, and a dessert. All dishes are vegetarian friendly. Bring your apron, we’ll supply everything else including the recipes to take home. Capacity limited. Registration required.Presenter: Carolyn Blackstock  Information for Museum Members Region of Waterloo Museums Member pricing: 10% off with code Enter your 8 digit Member ID followed by "STOVE" (i.e. 12345678STOVE) into the discount field and select "Apply" to get member pricing. Please note that your membership must be valid upon booking and on the event date, or access may be denied.

eventName: Beaded Bracelet Workshop with Haudenosaunee artisan, Susan Hill, at McDougall Cottage
description: On April 13th, our good friend, Haudenosaunee artisan, Susan Hill, will be returning to McDougall Cottage to lead another of her popular beaded bracelet workshops.  Over the course of the afternoon, participants will learn how to set a loom and everyone will come away with a lovely one-of-a-kind handmade piece! (Colours and patterns are subject to change).  This workshop is best for people age 12 years and up.   Susan’s workshops fill up fast, so be sure to reserve your spot today! Space is limited.  Cost: $50 per person, plus HST (includes all materials and instruction).  Indigenous members of the community will receive a discounted workshop fee by using the code: Beading90

Group activities focused on friendship building and empathy.We'll be focusing on the power of empathy and developing that superpower within us. description:
You’ve really gotten into SLR photography and would like to take it to the next level?Join us for a four-week course learning the tricks and magic of SLR photography.We will work on the exciting subjects of advanced portraiture with an introduction to studio lights, low light photography special effects, and photojournalism. This course will teach the mental process of image craft – using your camera as the tool to bring your vision to life.It is recommended that students master the techniques of the Basic and Intermediate courses before attempting this course. A separate flash unit and tripod will be needed for many of the lessons. As always, film or digital SLRs are welcome.AGE GROUP: |

location.name: Clemens Mill - Children's Program Room IdeaExchange

description:
Join us for a tour of the Queen's Square library and learn about our services, programs, and events.Depending on where you live, libraries offer different things. In some countries they are simply a spot where books are kept for sharing in others, well...they are a little more magical.Idea Exchange offers a wealth of resources, services, programs, and events to our community. Far from a dusty repository of books, it is a vibrant hub bustling with your new neighbours. With a mandate to inspire the exploration of reading, the arts, technology and lifelong learning, it welcomes all members of community to connect, collaborate, and discover.Join us for a tour of Idea Exchange, Queen's Square and learn about the programs, services, events, and resources that can help you feel settled, engaged, and at home here in Cambridge.COST: FreeAGE GROUP: |

description:
Fun hands-on STEM activities.Put your engineering hats on and explore different topics like coding, circuitry, and robotics.Week 1: April 16: Rock, Paper, Scissors, Code! Gear up for coding brilliance and friendly competition in our Microbit Rock-Paper-Scissors tournament! You will dive into the world of coding, designing, and customizing your game for an epic showdown. It’s not just about code; it’s about skill, strategy, and the thrill of emerging victorious in our ultimate Micro:bit RPS tournament!Week 2: April 23: Tinkering TerrainsHold on, it’s a bumpy ride...or is it? 3D design an all-terrain vehicle and be able to view it in the world of augmented reality! Learn all about terrains, vehicles, and mechanical engineers in the process.COST: FreeAGE GROUP: |

location.name: Old Post Office - Reading Room IdeaExchange

description:
Coyotes are one of the most despised animals on the continent. Although they are an ‘archpredator’ they are also largely misunderstood.Using dozens of photographs, journalist Paul Gains will describe the fascinating life of a coyote and outline how the war against them is a mistake.Paul Gains has been a full-time freelance journalist for 28 years. Besides writing for hundreds of global periodicals, his photos have appeared in the Toronto Star, The Herald (U.K.), N-Photo Magazine, National Post, Grand Magazine, CAA Magazine, and Canadian Geographic.COST: FreeAGE GROUP: |

Cambridge Community Clean Up Join Us!Saturday, April 20, 2024 9:30 a.m. - 12:30 p.m.Pick up supplies at these Idea Exchange locations:• Queen’s Square – 1 N. eventName: McDougall Cottage Soup and Stroll - “The Architecture of Galt”
description: Come for the stroll, stay for the soup!  What could be better than an interesting and enlightening stroll, followed by a warm bowl of hearty and delicious Scotch Broth soup in our cozy Cottage on the banks of the Grand?  Plan to join us for the first walk in our new Soup and Stroll Walking Tour Series. We'll be exploring the areas surrounding McDougall Cottage, focusing on the architecture of “The Granite City”. We'll take a look at how Scottish masons constructed the stone houses that the workers and business owners lived in and that the early industries of the areas were built on. We’ll talk about what happens when architectural heritage of an area is lost and how we can protect it for future generations. Finally, we’ll walk through the neighborhoods that host the baronial houses atop the hills of West Galt before heading back to the Cottage for a tasty treat.  Soup and Stroll Walking Tours can be enjoyed individually, or as a series.  This walking tour may include hills, stairs and uneven terrain. Participants should dress for the weather. Phones are recommended, but not required, to access additional information on the sites we’ll be visiting. Note: No washroom facilities available during tour.  The walks will leave the Cottage promptly at 10:00 a.m. and 1:00 p.m. Pre-registration is required and space is limited, so register early!  $35/participant (+HST ). Ticket includes walk and soup. This event is non-refundable.

eventName: Eco-friendly Craft Workshop Series at McDougall Cottage: Custom Garbage Grabbers in Honour of Earth Day!
description: Unleash your creativity and show some love for our beautiful planet!  Plan to join us at McDougall Cottage on Sunday, April 21 for a hands-on Custom Garbage Grabber Workshop in honour of Earth Day (April 22).  Our good friend, eco-crafting master, Jennifer Robles, a.k.a Jen of Green Gables, will once again be joining us to help let loose our artistic flair and use an array of craft and re-purposed materials to fashion a useful, fun and eco-friendly Custom Garbage Grabber– the perfect hiking companion for keeping our outdoor spaces pristine.  Guidance and all materials will be provided.  Best for kids age 6 years and up. Children must be accompanied by an adult. Families are welcome!Space is limited, so reserve your spot soon!

eventName: Connections 50+ Presents Cambridge Third Age Learning
description:
The making of a community play.We are building a 310 kilometer play that runs the length of the Grand River for August of 2025. Come hear about The Grand River Community Play Project: the Voice of a River - an inclusive adventure into creativity in the many ways we create. The structure is the Two Row – with Indigenous stories alongside Settler stories, with the third piece being the voice of the River herself. You’ll hear about where we’ve been and where we are going. This is the story of the River, created and developed by the people of the River, and ultimately told to those who are engaged and impacted by the River.About the event speakerPeter Smith is the Executive and Creative Director of the Canadian Centre for Rural Creativity (CCRC), based in Blyth, ON. The CCRC is an independent research centre and an environment for rural experiment, contributing to a sustainable world.Peter is an award-winning writer, actor, director, producer, and has worked coast-to-coast in Canada. He has been the artistic director of the Blyth Festival on two occasions, Playwright’s workshop in Montreal, Association Artistic Director, Canadian Stage. His film Tripping the Wire won a Gemini and a Hugo Award. His adaptation of the Iliad and Odyssey won a Meta Award. He is currently working on the Grand River Community Play Project, a 310 kilometer play that will be realized in 2025.COST: FreeAGE GROUP: |
Cambridge Art Galleries |
